meanings.definition: To score or mark in advance.
meanings.sent1: She prescores the test papers before the students arrive.
meanings.sent2: The teacher always prescores the assignments to save time during class.
meanings.sent3: The magician prescores the cards to perform a mind-blowing trick.
meanings.sent4: The athlete prescores the track with determination before the race begins.
meanings.sent5: The chef prescores the cake to ensure even slices for the party guests.

meanings.sent1: He received a high prescore on the exam, boosting his confidence.
meanings.sent2: The prescore for the project was impressive, showing great potential.
meanings.sent3: The prescore for the game was so high that everyone was excited to play.
meanings.sent4: The prescore on the music sheet guided the pianist through the performance.
meanings.sent5: The prescore on the map helped the hiker plan the route accurately.
